name: alimex
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1
body: |- wb(wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)), wi(wex(s0, wn(w1)), wn(w0)))

stmt.origin: bitri(wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)), wi(wex(s0, wn(w1)), wn(w0)), wi(w0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w1)))))

|- wb(wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)), wi(wex(s0, wn(w1)), wn(w0)))
-| wb(wi(w0, wal(s0, w1)), wi(w0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w1)))))
-| wb(wi(w0, wn(wex(s0, wn(w1)))), wi(wex(s0, wn(w1)), wn(w0)))

comment: An equivalence between an implication with a universally quantified consequent and an implication with an existentially quantified antecedent. An interesting case is when the same formula is substituted for both ` ph ` and ` ps ` , since then both implications express a type of non-freeness. See also ~ eximal . (Contributed by BJ, 12-May-2019.)
